entries.title: Biden Meets With Zelensky, Pledges Continued U.S. Support for Ukraine
entries.description: The Ukrainian president met with President Biden and plans to address Congress during a whirlwind bid for additional aid to help fend off Russia.

entries.title: U.S. Announces Nearly $2 Billion Arms Package Amid Zelensky Visit
entries.description: The new arms package includes the Patriot air-defense system and bomb kits that enable precision strikes.

entries.title: Putin to Boost Russian Military, Signaling Protracted War in Ukraine
entries.description: President approves big increase to troop levels and orders improved weaponry and upgraded communications

entries.title: Ukraine Defends Bakhmut Against Russian Assaults as Zelensky Heads to U.S.
entries.description: The city has become a key target for Russia, which is trying to seize all of the Donetsk province.

entries.title: Taliban Ban All Education for Girls
entries.description: The Taliban banned girls from attending elementary school, dealing one of the most dramatic blows yet to women’s freedoms since seizing power last year.

entries.title: Macron Renews Call for Security Guarantees for Russia
entries.description: The French president has doubled down on his call for the West to provide Russia with security guarantees as part of any negotiations to end the war.

entries.title: Europe Skirts a Winter Slump, but War Fallout Clouds Its Economic Future
entries.description: European businesses are looking to invest in the U.S. as high energy costs damp the continent’s ability to compete.

entries.title: Undercounted Deaths Cloud China's Zero-Covid Exit
entries.description: China’s National Health Commission on Wednesday said there had been no new Covid-related deaths—and that it was retracting one of the Beijing fatalities from the official tally.

entries.title: President Zelensky Looks to Firm Up Ties During Washington Visit
entries.description: The Ukrainian president will meet President Biden and address a joint session of Congress during his trip, which comes after U.S. lawmakers unveiled a spending bill that carries an additional $44.9 billion in aid to help Ukraine and its NATO allies.
